content.description:
Very sustained climbing at the 5.11+ grade. Just next to those comfy benches (benches are to the right). Get on this gem!

bolts to anchor

Haven't been on this yet. If you have please paste a description.

Betwen Aragon and Watchman, second route to the left of the benches
bolts to anchor

Bouldery and a big dyno make this 13b another great addition to the shield. Thanks Bonar! 
  
 If you want to take the grade down to 12d, a nice start just right of bob lob law makes this a bit easier.

4th route right of the benches
Bolts to anchor

You don't have to use the offwidth if you don't want to. That said, it's really nice to find something like this at a very sporty, limestone crag.  
  
 Go up the offwidth, milk the rest and fire the top. Enjoyable!

Big corner, often wet, between the switchbacks. If you take the switchback trail, one of the switchbacks should plop you right in front of this guy
Bolts to anchor

climbs.name: Crying Roof
climbs.fa: Marc Andre Cousineau and Greg Tos

content.description:
Another good, mid level route to try if it's your first time at the lookout. Find the roof and the line below it just up from a big tree. Grey and yellow streaked rock bring you to the hard roof pull

bolts to anchor

Start on a weird corner that heads left into jugs. follow the jug rail towards the right and then back towards the left. Once it slabs out, now you have to climb bullet hard, prickly grey rock to the top. Use your feet and it will be easy (don't pull!) 
  
 Great climb overall!

bolts to anchor

Probably not named after the death grips song: 
  
  youtube.com/watch?v=qe6hHnH… 
  
 Great climbing on great rock. Really tricky and so make sure to use your best ballerina climbing. Off the first platform before the shield.

Bolts to anchor

Locate a corner and follow it downhill. The route uphill and right of the corner is Texas Hold'em and the left one is November Rain 
  
 A good 5.9 but I wouldn't call home about it. Can be used as a good warmup

First obvious route in the scree slope of the lookout.
bolts

After the big group of trees there is a nice route which climbs near some yellow streaks. Fire the start and climb sustained face to the top. 
  
 The way to find is is that there is a long crack in a right facing dihedral above that looks too good to be true. The crux is low and this crack is the sweet reward!

Bolts to anchor

Good climbing with two options at the crux for those who wish to do it either way.


Not the two routes that go into the same anchor (tetris) but just left of that. Not on the shield proper but just right of the main shield. Starts off the top of the detached flake. 

Bolts to anchor

Right below a large group of trees, two routes up from the other obvious tree party.  
  
 Climb a crack up to the grey face to do some face climbing moves and then move right.

Bolts to anchor

Not the most enthralling climbing, a lose corner slabs out on the nice grey rock above. An interesting climb.

Find the corner below the dead tree. Not the nice offwidth corner of Caramel Macchiato, if you are there you've gone too far up
Bolts to anchor

climbs.name: Sheep Metal
climbs.fa: Marc Andre Cousineau, Allen Buchard and Greg Tos

content.description:
The easy arete is your game for this route. Climb up to a huge jug (left) and then back right towards the anchor. Slabs out at the end as usual

Between two bunches of trees, the middle route.
Bolts to anchor

Easy easy climbing to a hard roof and then a weird ending. Not sure if it's the best warm up around but some use it to warm up. Quite dusty, however, and very sharp still.

Last route before going up towards the balcony and Atlantis
Bolts to anchor.

A weird slab into that is harder than it looks (low 11, probably) moves into the business. Get into really incredible features (huge jugs and flakes) as it thins out quite a bit. A hard crux guards the anchors. (tip: look above the bolt for a key hold) 
  
 individually, the moves seem pretty easy at first but the route is pumpy.

Next to the bench.
Bolts to anchor

Easy climbing to the first roof. From there stuff gets hard quick with some small crimps, a throw to a big slopey left hand and a crimp traverse. Four clips of cruxing gets you to pull over the roof and you're done.

There is a placard, basically at the bottom of the huge detached pillar and very close to another line. The line to the left is a project.
Bolts to anchor

A Lloyd King route that was recently tackles a hard line through what has been described as a V8 boulder problem. Once you fire it, it's not over, so don't blow it!

Bolts to anchor

Excellent route that is well known as being a pretty hard, techy route in general.  
  
 Start up climbing towards and obvious left sloping rail at 4 meters. You will eventually get to the left of a roof with a right facing corner in it (bolt on the left side) and traverse right. The climb gets techy up top.


Take the path up from the Shield benches. The path switch backs away from the wall through the trees and cuts back towards the wall just above. Tetris starts right where the trail comes back to the wall, up from the stumps. Shared anchor with "Wasted on the Way" - Tetris is the right of the two bolt lines. 

8 bolts to anchors

Another good, mid hard route. Not as thuggy as stuff up at atlantis, you may have to use technique here.

Second route on the scree slope, after the corner (often wet)
Bolts

Tricky climbing starts about midway and ends shortly thereafter. Up a bit from tetris but not the route that starts off the ledge (Start line)

Not the route that starts on the big ledge, just to the left of this.
Bolts to anchor

Techy climbing throughout that goes to the same anchor as tetris.

Find the route tetris, just right of it. Alternatively, up from the shield wall, it's the 2nd route.
Bolts to anchor

Follow the bolts through some interesting climbing on that grey rock reminiscent of EEOR. Very prickly. Quite hard and committing at the top.

right of the last log platform before the shield benches.
Bolts to anchor

Big incut edges on an overhanging wall. Very different form the rest of the routes. Very aesthetic.

Far left side of the Shield. Number 18 in BVS.
Bolts

This is the area between the cave area and the balcony area. A good number of routes and some projects still. Very good rock, a number of people are working on the "shield" which are routes in the obvious shield near the top of the cliff. 
  
 A note for people who think this is a good idea to climb here in sunny weather: It really isn't a summer crag. The lookout (lower) offers almost no shade and is baking in the scree. You will arrive here with your water and instantly get sizzled during warm summer days. Better places to visit are Acephale, Lake Louise, The notch and other shady venues for summer. 
  
 As for those who choose to go at it during the early and late season, smaller crowds and better conditions will reward you. Good on you for choosing the right cliff!
